oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fork and spoon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One half of a knife, fork, & spoon combination used by Corporal Lorenzo Dow Atwood, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA. Atwood fought at Johnsonville, Tenn. On Nov. 4, 1864. His regiment was part of the garrison at the Johnsonville Depot. Atwood was from Fayette, Wisconsin, Lafayette County. His wife and daughter died while he was at Johnsonville. After the war he moved to NY. This fork and spoon were part of a larger set which also included a knife. The two pieces locked together.
